title: Which song puts you soundly asleep? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey, I don’t have a song. But I do have several CD’s that hush me into the shadowy world called sleep. First, ‘Era’ and ‘Era 2’ - two albums by a group called “Era”. They have a kind of Gregorian Chant sound with electronic/pop-rock elements that feels like new-age music (think Deep Forrest). It’s a great fusion and works very well. Also, the lyrics are written in and sound like Latin, but are deliberately meaningless. This is a bonus as you don’t want to be warbling along to the tune. Then there is the group called “Delirium”. You may have heard of this band as one of their songs, ‘Silence’, was very popular not so long ago. And it has been called one of the greatest trance songs, ever. The CD's that I like are ‘Semantic Spaces’, ‘Karma’, and ‘Chimera’. All have the power to soothe you into the ‘zone’. Do not have the volume up too high as this defeats the purpose. Barely audible is good. And no lights. If the above doesn’t work try playing an album of Gregorian Chants. And if this doesn’t flick the switch … perhaps someone will write in with something that does. Lovin' You by Minnie Riperton. The song's music is so beautifully simple, and gentle. Just 2 instruments acoustic guitar, and a keyboard, birds in background. The words are beautifully felt as she gently sings her own feelings in this beautiful song that can be almost be called in addition to a love song, a lullaby. I have gone to sleep and have woken up to this song, and it seems that I'm more at peace, calmer, and more rested, than if I had to listened to another song. It is truly a unique song that people never seem to get tired of, in the 43 years since it was done, truly a classic.
